title: Geological and taphonomic context for the new hominin species Homo naledi from the Dinaledi Chamber, South Africa
impactStatement: A new hominin species found in a South African cave is part of one of the most unusual hominin fossil assemblages on record.
authorLine: Paul HGM Dirks, Lee R Berger ... Steven Tucker

title: The age of Homo naledi and associated sediments in the Rising Star Cave, SouthÂ Africa
impactStatement: Independent dating techniques have established that the H. naledi fossils are between 236 and 335 thousand years old, indicating that small-brained hominins with relatively primitive body shapes co-existed with our early ancestors in Africa.
authorLine: Paul HGM Dirks, Eric M Roberts ... Lee R Berger

copyright.statement: This article is distributed under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution License, which permits unrestricted use and redistribution provided that the original author and source are credited.

title: New fossil remains of Homo naledi from the Lesedi Chamber, South Africa
impactStatement: The discovery of new skeletal remains of Homo naledi in the Lesedi Chamber, South Africa, adds more evidence to our understanding of the morphology and behavior of this recently discovered species.
authorLine: John Hawks, Marina Elliott ... Lee R Berger

title: Homo naledi and Pleistocene hominin evolution in subequatorial Africa
impactStatement: A late Middle Pleistocene age for Homo naledi demonstrates a diversity of hominin species in Africa at this critical time in the archaeological record.
authorLine: Lee R Berger, John Hawks ... Eric M Roberts
